availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph M. Stotts (Hart County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier in 33rd and 26th KY)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Indiana native. Married to Diana F. Wiltshire Stotts. Father of William L. Stotts, Virginia F. Stotts, James C. Stotts, and Phebe Jane Rouaseaur Stotts. Farmer in Hart County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hart County in 1860. Served in Company C 33rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Waggoner from September 13, 1862 to April 1, 1864. Served in Company I 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) from April 1, 1864 to June 30, 1865.

ab.bibl:

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 382.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 405.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994038, Hart County Births p. 3.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 236, 243.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #326554.
